descriptions.description: More maintainer time increases the rate at which issues can be resolved.
A higher number of open issues motivates contributors to submit more pull requests.
More open issues generate more user and contributor feedback about problems.
Feedback from users and contributors often identifies new issues or clarifies existing ones.
A larger codebase increases complexity, leading to a higher rate of issue discovery.
A larger queue of pull requests under review increases the potential merge rate.
A larger queue of pull requests under review increases the potential for rejections.
Merging pull requests adds new code and features to the source code stock.
More core developers increase the capacity for mentorship and implicit knowledge transfer.
Effective mentorship accelerates the promotion of experienced contributors to core developers.
Project's implicit knowledge depreciates as contributors leave or forget details.
Explicit knowledge is converted to implicit understanding through practice and application.
Converting explicit knowledge to implicit understanding increases the stock of implicit knowledge.
A richer searchable knowledge base directly increases the stock of explicit knowledge.
Feedback from pull request reviews is documented, enriching the searchable knowledge base.
Closed issues provide resolved examples and solutions for the searchable knowledge base.
Community discussions capture decisions and context for the searchable knowledge base.
New contributors gain skills through participation, increasing their skill-up rate.
The skill-up flow moves contributors from the new to the experienced contributor stock.
Experienced contributors are the primary pool from which promotions to core developer occur.
The promotion rate flow adds new members to the core developer stock.
The joining rate flow determines the influx of new contributors to the project.
Good documentation and guides lower the barrier to entry, increasing the joining rate.
Explicit knowledge transfer through documentation accelerates the skill-up process.
The stock of explicit knowledge is the source material for creating documentation and guides.
A larger backlog of open issues creates pressure to increase the issue resolution rate.
The issue resolution rate flow moves issues from open to the closed issues stock.
More core developers reduce the average delay for pull request reviews.
Shorter review delays enable faster and more iterative feedback on pull requests.
Timely and constructive PR feedback encourages new contributors to remain engaged.
Effective PR feedback helps experienced contributors refine their skills and contributions.
High-quality PR feedback is a core developer activity that reinforces their role.
New contributors generate PR feedback as they submit their own pull requests for review.
Experienced contributors generate PR feedback by reviewing others' pull requests.
PR feedback leads to revisions, keeping pull requests in the under-review state longer.
The adoption rate flow increases the user base as new users start using the software.
The user churn rate flow decreases the user base as users stop using the software.
Positive project outcomes and community interactions build the project's reputation.
Negative events, bugs, or community conflict cause the project's reputation to decline.
High software quality and rich features positively influence the project's reputation.
A larger user base provides social proof and visibility, enhancing project reputation.
Positive interactions and reliable collaboration build trust, improving community health.
Conflict, burnout, and toxic interactions erode the culture and health of the community.
A healthy community with good collaboration is a positive signal for project reputation.
A strong project reputation attracts more potential contributors, increasing the joining rate.
A positive project reputation makes the project more appealing to new contributors.
